Matthew Stevenson, M.D.

Board-certified neurologist with fellowship training in clinical neurophysiology and epilepsy.

More

Experience

General Neurology with focus on Epilepsy

Multicare Health Systems, Puyallup, Washington
2016 - Present

Joined established neurology division within multispecialty integrated healthcare system to provide EEG interpretation and epilepsy expertise for eastern Pierce County. Continued general neurology practice with roughly 40-50% epilepsy focus.

General Neurology

Clinical Neuroscience, Fort Worth, Texas
2012 - 2016

Joined established small single-specialty group to provide general neurology care. Spearheaded adoption of EHR, including research of software and hardware options.

More

Education and Training

Fellowship in Clinical Neurophysiology, EEG Track

University of Michigan
2011 - 2012

Subspecialty training in EEG interpretation and Epilepsy management

Neurology Residency

University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center at Dallas
2007 - 2011

Rigorous training in general neurology with broad exposure to all subspecialty fields

Medical School

University of Texas Southwestern Medical School in Dallas
2003 - 2007

Graduated top third of the class.

Publications

  1. Victoria S.S. Wong, Matthew Stevenson, and Linda Selwa, “The presentation of seizures and epilepsy in YouTube videos,” Epilepsy and Behavior vol. 27:1 (247-250).
  2. Amer M. Awad and Mathew Stevenson, “Isolated Central Nervous System Vasculitis Associated with Antiribonuclear Protein Antibody,” Case Reports in Neurological Medicine, vol. 2011, Article ID 495201, 4 pages, 2011. doi:10.1155/2011/495201.
  3. February 2010 Carrell-Krusen Neuromuscular Symposium Dallas, TX Myopathy with Ataxia: case report of nemaline myopathy associated with a cerebellar ataxia syndrome
